text:
Dale Weldeau Jorgenson (born May 7, 1933) is an American economist. He is the Samuel W. Morris University Professor at Harvard University. He also taught at the John F. Kennedy School of Government. He was Chairman of the Department of Economics from 1994 to 1997. He was born in Bozeman, Montana. In 1978, he was elected to the National Academy of Sciences.
Jorgenson supports carbon tax on greenhouse gas emissions as a means of reducing global warming.
